excerpts: I like this place mainly due to the salad bar - but it also has a lunch buffet.
Get in and get out quickly and sit in the city center enjoying your lunch and people watc
salad bar.author: Louis M.
salad bar.review: I like this place mainly due to the salad bar - but it also has a lunch buffet. Get in and get out quickly and sit in the city center enjoying your lunch and people watc

excerpts: They also offer great options for lunch including a salad bar - which I've yet to try
salad bar.author: Ashley L.
salad bar.review:
This place is the spot for breakfast. And an answer to prayers if you happen to have a hangover but have to work.

They serve more than breakfast but I only come early in the morning. 

They offer everything you could want for your breakfast cravings (French toast, bagels, egg platters, breakfast burritos etc).

They also offer great options for lunch including a salad bar - which I've yet to try but I might soon. 

Service is quick and staff is friendly. 

This is my go to spot due to the convenience of the location but I know of other people who work in the financial district and go out of their way to stop by in the morning. 

I'll be back soon.

excerpts: I've ordered breakfast sandwiches and deli sandwiches here; I can't comment on the salad bar.
The service is always fast and friendly and the place looks and feel very clean.
I got the #6 today and it's huge and delicious.
I'd definitely recommend it for a less expensive lunch in the area.
salad bar.author: Angie B.
salad bar.review: I've ordered breakfast sandwiches and deli sandwiches here; I can't comment on the salad bar. The service is always fast and friendly and the place looks and feel very clean. I got the #6 today and it's huge and delicious. I'd definitely recommend it for a less expensive lunch in the area.

excerpts: There is a hot food bar and a salad bar located at the back of the restaurant.
You can also order breakfast, wraps, crepes, sandwiches and paninis at the front counter.
They offer chips, sodas, and cookies as add ons.
The quality is decent and the portions are generous.
I need to express the value of this place.
salad bar.author: Jennifer B.
salad bar.review:
Fountain cafe is one of my go to lunch spots. It's located on the third floor of Crocker Galleria. I always get my food to go so I can sit out under the glass arced roof or the roof garden, which allows me to enjoy my lunch under the sun, rain, fog, etc. 

The guys that work here are sweet and always greet me upon arrival. Service is fast, yet personable. The guy who usually works at the hot food bar always remembers my order... Baked potato and mixed veggies, please and thank you! 

The menu is extensive. There is a hot food bar and a salad bar located at the back of the restaurant. You can also order breakfast, wraps, crepes, sandwiches and paninis at the front counter. They offer chips, sodas, and cookies as add ons. The quality is decent and the portions are generous. I need to express the value of this place. I get so stoked that I can get a yummy lunch for $5!!! 

I recommend this place for a fast, filling and inexpensive lunch in the downtown area.

excerpts: For lunch, they do have a salad bar, burger specials, and hot food specials every day.
Again, think value, not excellence, and you'll be satisfied.
salad bar.author: Jason P.
salad bar.review:
Here's what I like about this place: It opens early for breakfast (unusual in our laid-back west coast city). Basic diner food, for a decent price. you can get bacon, eggs, hash browns, and toast for about $6.00. Is it the best diner food? No. But if you're tired of paying $20 for a basic breakfast, you won't be disappointed. 

For lunch, they do have a salad bar, burger specials, and hot food specials every day. Again, think value, not excellence, and you'll be satisfied.

excerpts: It's nothing spectacular but Fountain Cafe is one of the more reliable spots in Crocker for a quick grab and go kind of lunch be it the salad bar or items from the ala carte menu.
In a rush, the by-the-pound salad bar is the fastest way in and out.
My defaults are the salad wraps though.
The grilled chicken Cesar salad wrap with a spinach tortilla is typically the first choice although I've had the chicken apple salad wrap fairly often too.
Both are under $6.
It's quick, cheap, and just the right amount of food for workday lunch.
As a bonus, they take cards  which makes it faster and more convenient.
Not everything's a hit though.
salad bar.author: Jon L.
salad bar.review:
It's nothing spectacular but Fountain Cafe is one of the more reliable spots in Crocker for a quick grab and go kind of lunch be it the salad bar or items from the ala carte menu. 

In a rush, the by-the-pound salad bar is the fastest way in and out. My defaults are the salad wraps though. The grilled chicken Cesar salad wrap with a spinach tortilla is typically the first choice although I've had the chicken apple salad wrap fairly often too. Both are under $6. It's quick, cheap, and just the right amount of food for workday lunch. As a bonus, they take cards  which makes it faster and more convenient. Not everything's a hit though. Personally was unimpressed with the falafel sandwich which tasted stale. 

Reasonably friendly staff pushing out food as quickly as possible to get you out the door is a quick plus here. While not everything is an ace, the extensive menu covers quite a bit from all-day breakfast to burgers and fried chicken strips. You'll probably find something here and if you have time, take it up to the roof of Crocker Galleria and enjoy some sunshine while you're at it.

excerpts: they also serve other foods like sandwiches, panini, pasta, and they have an open salad bar!
so i ended up ordering a denver omelette that comes your choice of toast & hashbrown (or potatoes) and garlic fries for less than $10!!
and you get your food pretty quick.
i think they gave me a generous amount of garlic fries for $2.29.
how amazing is that?!
the food here is good, but not spectacular.
i love their hashbrowns and garlic fries.
i've ordered a breakfast quesadilla before and it was pretty good too.
salad bar.author: Sylvia H.
salad bar.review:
i love getting cheap breakfast food here for lunch. i know, i know who orders a denver omelette for lunch? well, i do haha. they serve breakfast here all day. they also serve other foods like sandwiches, panini, pasta, and they have an open salad bar! so i ended up ordering a denver omelette that comes your choice of toast & hashbrown (or potatoes) and garlic fries for less than $10!! and you get your food pretty quick. i think they gave me a generous amount of garlic fries for $2.29. how amazing is that?! the food here is good, but not spectacular. i love their hashbrowns and garlic fries. i've ordered a breakfast quesadilla before and it was pretty good too. just don't expect high quality food for the price.

there's plenty of seating inside and outside (since it's located inside the crocker galleria). there's also two outdoor seating areas inside the crocker galleria. there's the rooftop garden and the rooftop terrace, they're located on the opposite sides of the galleria. just look for the signs!

excerpts: This place has everything you could possibly want from sandwiches, both hot and cold, soup, salad bar, hot food section with choices such as chicken cordon blue, chicken parm, spaghetti and meatballs, and many others.
They serve a variety of breakfast dishes all day.
The atmosphere is clean and the employees are friendly.
salad bar.author: Michelle V.
salad bar.review: This place has everything you could possibly want from sandwiches, both hot and cold, soup, salad bar, hot food section with choices such as chicken cordon blue, chicken parm, spaghetti and meatballs, and many others. They serve a variety of breakfast dishes all day. The atmosphere is clean and the employees are friendly.

excerpts: There's a salad bar in the back for $7.50/lb.
salad bar.author: Benita M.
salad bar.review:
Ventured into this cafe at the top floor of the Crocker Galleria. Free wifi and plenty of tables and chairs. Wasn't very packed during lunch hours but it was a full house. There's a salad bar in the back for $7.50/lb. Sandwiches and wraps are decent price $5-6.

Got myself a seafood wrap. For $5.29, you get yourself a 6 inch long wrap filled with imitated crab meat and veges. Nothing really special about this wrap that would cause me to order it again...

excerpts: There is a self-serve salad bar in the back that you pay up at front.
salad bar.author: Jerianne G.
salad bar.review:
If i could give half stars, this place would be 3.5 at the most.

Located on the third floor of Crocker Galleria, the hubs & I stumbled upon this place because of the fancy sign to be honest. But when we approached the place, we saw that they sold breakfast platters, as well as sandwiches, crepes, and salads.

It's pretty spacious with several tables inside and outside. There is a self-serve salad bar in the back that you pay up at front. 

A lot of their foods are sort've pricey. They range from $2- $7 usually. We stuck with a sandwich and a wrap.
- Chicken Apple Salad Wrap: ($5 ish) This was a fairly decent wrap. Has a good amount of chicken and green apple slices along with red onions, lettuce, and a creamy vinagrette type of sauce.
- Turkey Cranberry Sandwich: ($6 ish) you can customize this sandwich by choosing your bread, cheese, and whether you want to remove condiments or add some. We had it with wheat roll and American cheese. This was also a fairly good sandwich. Has a nice amount of cranberry sauce and turkey, and the bread wasnt too hard to bite into. 

While the food was good, the workers were kinda snooty. The woman behind the register was sneering a lot at the other customers. Not sure if she was having an off day, but yeah, not the greatest customer service. Wifi is available but slow.

excerpts: They have a couple of options here, salad bar, combination plates, and cafe menu items.
I got a combination plate with one entree and two sides.
I picked the chicken, vegetables, and rice.
The chicken had a tasty bbq glaze but the inside was very dry.
The mixed vegetables were barely cooked and very crunchy.
The plate also came with a bread.
The only pro was that the portion sizes were big.
salad bar.author: James S.
salad bar.review: They have a couple of options here, salad bar, combination plates, and cafe menu items. I got a combination plate with one entree and two sides. I picked the chicken, vegetables, and rice. The chicken had a tasty bbq glaze but the inside was very dry. The mixed vegetables were barely cooked and very crunchy. The plate also came with a bread. The only pro was that the portion sizes were big.

excerpts: Fountain's salad bar is the chronic of all salad bars in the FiDi.
salad bar.author: Sunny S.
salad bar.review:
Let's count this down--makes it easier on both of us: 

10. Best breakfast burrito--you will instantly gain five pounds and you won't be able to eat for the rest of the day, but this hangover helper does the job. 

9. Fountain's salad bar is the chronic of all salad bars in the FiDi. They even have falafel! 

8. Clam chowder. It's not loaded with potatoes (i.e., filler). It's creamy. It's delicious. It's served on Fridays. It's $2.50. 

7. Bagels! There are all kinds of flavors. I recommend the jalapeño cheddar. Get it toasted. Get cream cheese on the side. Get $2.50 out of the bottom of your purse. Then get going. 

6. What in the hell is chicken coteletti? I don't know either, but one of these days I'm going to order it just for S&G. Fountain has it every day! 

5. All of their soups are yummy! Cream of asparagus, cream of cauliflower, cream of broccoli - oh yes, they are all yummy. 

4. They do serve beer, but why are you going to the Crocker Galleria to drink beer? 

3. Quick service--cause we're in a big hurry! Fountain has more than one person working the registers, and their menu is designed to move food out quickly. 

2. You can get a dessert crepe or baked salmon with brown rice or a BLT or enchiladas here. Now that's a diverse menu. 

~AND~ 

1. Yet another lunch spot under $10 in the FiDi. Hurrah!

excerpts: I was always able to get a good lunch for under $8 and the salad bar was my favorite.
I always grabbed some of their cold pasta (with the spinach) and mixed it with some real salad so it would fill me up better.
salad bar.author: Renee Y.
salad bar.review:
My favorite go to lunch place when I worked by Maiden Lane. I was always able to get a good lunch for under $8 and the salad bar was my favorite. I always grabbed some of their cold pasta (with the spinach) and mixed it with some real salad so it would fill me up better. They have tons of toppings too so you can add all the things you love, just remember to not go too crazy. 

Like others have said the cashiers are pretty rude. All they do is talk to each other and look like they hate their lives, but whatevs. I only have to deal with them when I pay my food and that less than a minute worth of interaction. 

I definitely recommend coming here for lunch if you don't want to spend that much.

excerpts: Having sandwiches, a salad bar, breakfast and coffee selections, this cafe fits the standard of being a cafe!
salad bar.author: Tiffany D.
salad bar.review:
I must say that they face tough competition with restaurants next door, in Crocker Galleria and many restaurants on Kearny Street.

I bet Financial District workers who get off at lunch are extremely confused on where they should fill their stomach hunger!  This place is conveniently located in Crocker Galleria and targeted to financial district working class during lunch hours to grab cafe food!

Having sandwiches, a salad bar, breakfast and coffee selections, this cafe fits the standard of being a cafe!

Don't expect fine, fancy food here, but a good meal for lunch!

Wi-Fi is pretty slow - probably because there are so many other Wi-Fi and usage in this area!

They do have unbeatable butter bagels for $1.25!  Toasted and buttered to quick perfection!

Commendable service and orders are served pretty quickly!

excerpts: Also there is a good salad bar and a specials bar.
Overall the widest menu of any place I know about.
I like quality & variety, so this place suits me.
I usually get the #7 sandwich (chicken, bacon, avocado,) off the main menu and toast it at my office (but they will toast the bread for you if you want.)
They put a lot of stuff on it (mustard, mayo, tomatoes, lettuce, pickles, onions) so be sure to tailor it to what you want.
The sandwich is perfect and the bacon is truly excellent.
$6.50 plus tax, one of the best deals anywhere downtown.
But the real reason I'm writing today is because for the past two days I've had a particular specials bar offering.
The specials rotate daily and has such things as Chicken or pork Collette, pork ribs, chicken Parmesan or Piccata, Lasagna or penne Bolognese, and many others.
I think the full menu is about 25 items, with about 10 out on any given day.
What I've had there the last 2 days is truly excellent and I have passed on it many times.
I will probably never make that mistake again.
It was the baked salmon.
It was as good as any salmon I've ever had anywhere.
I am talking as good as $35 salmon plates I've had at the finest restos in the city.
The reason I've never ordered it before?
You know that crappy salmon that is dry as a bone on the inside that you typically get at a café?
I hate that with a passion.
It is like eating slightly damp, warm  newspaper.
But yesterday, it looked inviting, and I needed to eat something lower in calories, and with the 2 slices of lemon on top it looked great.
So I took the chance.
Best.
Decision.
Ever.
The salmon was bowl-me-over good!
Just perfectly moist inside, just a little crisp on the outside.
The lemon provides a perfect tartness to it when you poke it a bit to release the juice.
The salmon is simply prepared, just a hint of salt maybe.
Now comes the best part: With your specials entrée you get a decent sized side (Caesar, spaghetti, mashed potatoes, or veggies [mostly squash])
AND bread for --- $9.05 including tax.
You are out the door with a tremendous piece of salmon, salad and bread.
Try to find that anywhere in S.F.
I dare ya.
salad bar.author: Jeff S.
salad bar.review:
I've been coming here for years (I work right across the street) and I never thought to leave a review for any of the Crocker Galleria places until now. This one is long overdue and I hope I can make up for lost time.
The Fountain Café is really quite an excellent lunch place. They have their fairly large standard menu of typical sandwiches, salad, soup and grill foods including hamburgers and grilled cheese. Also there is a good salad bar and a specials bar. Overall the widest menu of any place I know about. I like quality & variety, so this place suits me. I usually get the #7 sandwich (chicken, bacon, avocado,) off the main menu and toast it at my office (but they will toast the bread for you if you want.) The salmon is simply prepared, just a hint of salt maybe. Now comes the best part: With your specials entrée you get a decent sized side (Caesar, spaghetti, mashed potatoes, or veggies [mostly squash]) AND bread for --- $9.05 including tax. You are out the door with a tremendous piece of salmon, salad and bread. Try to find that anywhere in S.F. I dare ya.

excerpts: Salad bar is nifty as well...but too much effort for my lunch time.
salad bar.author: Carina M.
salad bar.review:
I get the grilled ham and cheese here. Comfort food for me at lunch. I feel like I'm 13 again, at diner with my folks after a Sunday night church service.

It's located in the Crocker Galleria and has pretty diverse menu (of sandwhiches and breakfast items)

Salad bar is nifty as well...but too much effort for my lunch time.

excerpts: My boyfriend loves their salad bar.
I think it's just an average salad bar, but whatever, he's entitled to his opinion.
I ordered a turkey, avocado wrap.
It was just over $5, and really tiny.
That is to be expected in the FiDi, so I let the size of the wrap go.
What I couldn't let go of was the fact that there was aluminum foil inside my wrap from when they cut it in half.
salad bar.author: Alanna R.
salad bar.review:
The people who work here are RUDE. 
I have been here a few times. My boyfriend loves their salad bar. I think it's just an average salad bar, but whatever, he's entitled to his opinion. 
I ordered a turkey, avocado wrap. It was just over $5, and really tiny. That is to be expected in the FiDi, so I let the size of the wrap go. 
What I couldn't let go of was the fact that there was aluminum foil inside my wrap from when they cut it in half. I would have picked the foil out and let it slide, but the fact that they are sooooo rude and thankless when you purchase food from them, I decided to take it back. 

***WTF, I am paying you MONEY. Be nice to me. Duh.  It's good for business when you are good to your customers. But they just literally do not give a rats a$% because they think you are expendable. 

Anyway, I asked for my money back and the guy manager made excuses, was pissed, wouldn't look at me, handed me the money like a total jerk, and didn't apologize. Wow. That's some pretty abrasive behavior. 

I am never coming back there, and will steer anyone who suggests it away and let them know how they treat customers. 

You people need to learn some customer service skills. You suck. Bye.

excerpts: The salad bar looked good too; I finished the meal with apple juice.
salad bar.author: Bert K.
salad bar.review:
Seems to be A-ok.

Tried the plate lunch today, for $8.38, you get two phat tamales, a generous serving of spanish rice and a side casaer salad.
The Tamales had nice sized chunks of pork, that was tastey and cooked with flavor. Smooth corn maize was missing the characteristic nuggets of ground corn, but none the less, was tastey. The rice was good too;  and you get a generous amount of fresh green salad. Muy Sabor. Good quality is never cheap. The salad bar looked good too; I finished the meal with apple juice.

They have a selection of fruit drinks, including Aranchiatta, Limoncetta and Apple Juice. 

I'll return.

Customer service: ok and speedy.

Decor: ok.

p.s. they told me they make their daily specials from scratch. Those tamales were dang good!

excerpts: Had lunch here now for several years, and always blown away by the home cook food and awesome salad bar.
Just a great atmosphere and a fair price to be paid.
Always take clients and friends to this food oasis, that produces healthy, hearty food and a good price.
salad bar.author: Karl M.
salad bar.review:
Had lunch here now for several years, and always blown away by the home cook food and awesome salad bar.  Just a great atmosphere and a fair price to be paid.
Always take clients and friends to this food oasis, that produces healthy, hearty food and a good price.

excerpts: Nice salad bar, many selections.
Middle Eastern choices such as pita, hummus and falafel.
salad bar.author: Abigail J. M. M.
salad bar.review:
Nice salad bar, many selections.  Middle Eastern choices such as pita, hummus and falafel.  Clean looking.  

Falafel was really, very dry and the service could use some friendliness, but overall, it is a nice place.  About $7.50 a lbs for salad.

excerpts: I ear from their salad bar
so I can't comment on the hot food.
The salad bar is always fresh, with a nice selection of meats, veggies, and condiments.
The grilled chicken is always tasty.
I also love their tabouli as well.
Friendly staff.
I've been going there for years.
I would go more often if they restated the salad bar selection from time to time.
salad bar.author: Martin B.
salad bar.review: The best lunch deal in Crocker Galleria.  I ear from their salad bar so I can't comment on the hot food.  The salad bar is always fresh, with a nice selection of meats, veggies, and condiments.  The grilled chicken is always tasty.  I also love their tabouli as well. Friendly staff.  I've been going there for years.  I would go more often if they restated the salad bar selection from time to time.

excerpts: This place has an AMAZING salad bar filled with tons of veggies and a variety of different kinds of pasta and other salads.
salad bar.author: Stephanie T.
salad bar.review:
This place has an AMAZING salad bar filled with tons of veggies and a variety of different kinds of pasta and other salads. 

They also have a great grill and will make you almost anything you want. I ordered a grilled cheese and asked them to add tomato, no problem. It was delicious. 

Defiantly my new favorite lunch spot!

excerpts: The salad bar has a good fruit selection, a variety of pasta salads, and a bunch of fixing for a Greek salad (tabouli, hummus, pita bread, etc).
salad bar.author: Talia G.
salad bar.review:
$4 OFF TODAY ANYWHERE IN THE CROCKER GALLERIA. Feb 29th Only.

AFTER the discount, I paid $4.25 for a pretty decently-sized salad. The salad bar has a good fruit selection, a variety of pasta salads, and a bunch of fixing for a Greek salad (tabouli, hummus, pita bread, etc). 

That said, I probably won't return without another discount...there are a lot of sandwich/salad places in the Financial District.

excerpts: Salad bar has a good selection too
but it bothers me that they don't post the per pound price.
It's probably the only place in this immed area that doesn't have the salad bar price psoted that I can think of.
What are they trying to hide?
Anyway, it's $8.99/lb as of TODAY.
Most of the time the staff is pretty friendly.
My good timing I guess....
salad bar.author: Luisa k.
salad bar.review: Great breakfast deal for FiDi. I usually get the pancake special or an omelet. Also good deal for burgers & fries. Salad bar has a good selection too but it bothers me that they don't post the per pound price. It's probably the only place in this immed area that doesn't have the salad bar price psoted that I can think of. What are they trying to hide? Anyway, it's $8.99/lb as of TODAY. Most of the time the staff is pretty friendly. My good timing I guess....

excerpts: Salad bar fair $7 something per Lb.
PER POUND
Don't be surprise if you end up with a $20 salad.. Service?
The cashiers are NICE.
Sometimes people are too busy on their phones or talking with their colleagues.
It seems people now days want their behind kissed and wiped.....
Prices are fair for the FIDI area.
There is a .10 cent fee for bags.
This is the LAW not the business or the cashiers fault.
How ever I'm giving this place 4 stars because they need a espresso machine.
salad bar.author: Sophia B.
salad bar.review: I come here almost everyday. Hot food is the best! The menu changes everyday. Fresh from the grill items are good! Sometimes it satisfies my taste buds better than other days. Salad bar fair $7 something per Lb. PER POUND   Don't be surprise if you end up with a $20 salad.. Service? The cashiers are NICE. Sometimes people are too busy on their phones or talking with their colleagues. It seems people now days want their behind kissed and wiped..... Prices are fair for the FIDI area. There is a .10 cent fee for bags. This is the LAW not the business or the cashiers fault.How ever I'm giving this place 4 stars because they need a espresso machine.

excerpts: Fountain Cafe has been my favorite FiDi salad bar for years.
As soon as I walk through the door the salad bar calls out to me
and I can't choose anything else!
salad bar.author: Valeria R.
salad bar.review:
Note: This is the Fountain Cafe in the Crocker Galleria and not the one near the foot of Sutter.

Fountain Cafe has been my favorite FiDi salad bar for years. They always have such fresh and interesting choices.

I usually build my salad with a bed of dark greens topped with babaganouj and tabbouleh and a few dolmas. Amazingly, I think they make their dolmas there because they definitely do NOT taste or feel like canned. Their hummus is okay, but the babaganouj is miles better.

Some of my other favorites there are the curry chicken salad with shell pasta, raisins and chunks of apple and celery. When they have it, I load up on the "lite" turkey salad made in the style of chicken salad. They sometimes have falafels, but I usually pass on those as they tend to be on the dry side. I also wish they would change their brand of pita, but I give them points for usually having plain AND whole wheat on hand.

Among their vegetable options they have plain artichoke hearts, which I love because the delicate artichoke flavor is not overpowered by vinaigrette.

Their hot food selections are enormously popular but I have to admit that I have never tried any of them. As soon as I walk through the door the salad bar calls out to me and I can't choose anything else!

excerpts: An excellent salad bar and terrific daily specials make the Fountain Cafe located on the top level of the Crocker Galleria a very good place for lunch.
salad bar.author: Wilhelm Y.
salad bar.review:
An excellent salad bar and terrific daily specials make the Fountain Cafe located on the top level of the Crocker Galleria a very good place for lunch.

Coincidentally I had the Pollo Cacciatori just like David D. on Tuesday afternoon.  A tender extended chicken leg piece with soft green and yellow bell peppers, slivered onions and meaty tomatoes served over a bed of rice with a creamy, crunchy, cheesy Caesar Salad and a soft torpedo roll on the side.

Fountain Cafe has four hot entree specials each day in addition to a large menu featuring lots of regular breakfast and lunch selections.  There is plenty of seating inside of the restaurant in addition to the vast number of tables and chairs along the outer railings of the center and in the Roof Garden.

The service is fast and friendly and the food is inexpensive and filling.

excerpts: I really like going to this place for my salad bar and soup combo - so they don't have that many choices for soup but they consistently change their offerings and I always find a soup to my liking - $3 for soup beats Soup company that charges $6 for same size and I cannto say that they taste 2x better!
Once in a while I'll get something from the hot foods station - meats are always cooked well, pasta's not

their greatest strength - sandiches are full and pretty tasty... breakfast is good too - they are ok with your customization and rarely mess my order up (I am s bit picky as I have a few food allergies, and like to change things around a bit :) )
Overall I'd give them 4.5 but since I cannot, they get a 5.
VERY AFFORDABLE and ask for the discount card - if you buy 8 lunches over $6 you get $6 worth of food for free - my salad/soup combo is usually around $7...
salad bar.author: Zayka Z.
salad bar.review:
I really like going to this place for my salad bar and soup combo - so they don't have that many choices for soup but they consistently change their offerings and I always find a soup to my liking - $3 for soup beats Soup company that charges $6 for same size and I cannto say that they taste 2x better!  Once in a while I'll get something from the hot foods station - meats are always cooked well, pasta's not their greatest strength - sandiches are full and pretty tasty... breakfast is good too - they are ok with your customization and rarely mess my order up (I am s bit picky as I have a few food allergies, and like to change things around a bit :) )
Overall I'd give them 4.5 but since I cannot, they get a 5.  VERY AFFORDABLE and ask for the discount card - if you buy 8 lunches over $6 you get $6 worth of food for free - my salad/soup combo is usually around $7...

excerpts: What makes the place stand out, however, is the fantastic salad bar at $6.39/pound (a guy at our office comes for the salad bar every day for lunch).
There is a wide variety of salad items, with the grilled chicken being my favorite.
Unfortunately though, there wasn't grilled chicken when I went today.
All in all a good find, and I will definitely be back for the salad bar in the future.
salad bar.author: Andrew Y.
salad bar.review: I came here originally to try the sandwiches (#8) which were pretty good. There are probably better sandwiches and better value out there, but it was definitely solid. What makes the place stand out, however, is the fantastic salad bar at $6.39/pound (a guy at our office comes for the salad bar every day for lunch). There is a wide variety of salad items, with the grilled chicken being my favorite. Unfortunately though, there wasn't grilled chicken when I went today. All in all a good find, and I will definitely be back for the salad bar in the future.

excerpts: This was because it is well located in Crocker Galleria and has a huge, diverse salad bar.
salad bar.author: Diane B.
salad bar.review:
I used to lurk at this place a lot when I worked in the FiDi at a (gasp) full time job. This was because it is well located in Crocker Galleria and has a huge, diverse salad bar.

Now that I'm a nomadic worker who needs to pay a smidge more attention to basic infrastructure issues, I've come to appreciate this place even more: (1) there is free wifi and power outlets (well, a few shhhhh) all in Crocker; and (2) you can get some hearty *breakfast* at a REALLY cheap price. I got me some eggs, sausage, toast and coffee for about $6 the other day! 

Plus the staff is SUPER uber meta friendly: nailed my customized order, handled the crazy busy morning line with poise and effectiveness, and all with a smile. 

So, while Fountain is not Michelin level, it serves us po' folk just fine!

excerpts: The salad bar has lots of variety, but I'm totally not ok with paying $12 for a big box of lettuce.
I go to the Galeria for the farmer's market on Thursday, buy a week's worth of salad fixings, and make a salad at my desk.
salad bar.author: Aaron M.
salad bar.review:
The sandwiches are pretty tasty, but Lee's a block away is cheaper, faster, and about the same quality (although lacking in seating). 

The salad bar has lots of variety, but I'm totally not ok with paying $12 for a big box of lettuce. I go to the Galeria for the farmer's market on Thursday, buy a week's worth of salad fixings, and make a salad at my desk. MUCH cheaper.

My co-worker is hooked on their egg-mc-fountain sandwich, it's one of the few breakfast places in the FiDi that actually fries the egg up fresh instead of nuking a pre-made sandwich. Fountain is my favorite lunch spot at the Crocker Galeria, but it's nothing special.

excerpts: They have a pretty decent salad bar at lunch.
It's a fast/convenient place to grab a bit, but nothing too extraordinarily amazing.
salad bar.author: Ariana L.
salad bar.review:
You can get breakfast burritos with lots of veggies but watch out, the salsa makes it kinda soggy and messy if you don't eat it immediately.
They have a pretty decent salad bar at lunch.
It's a fast/convenient place to grab a bit, but nothing too extraordinarily amazing.

excerpts: Just found a bug the size of my fingernail clinging to a piece of lettuce from the salad bar.
Makes me think that they don't wash the lettuce
-- what else don't they wash before serving it?
GROSS - goodbye fountain cafe.
there are better places to go in the Crocker.
salad bar.author: Kathleen B.
salad bar.review: Just found a bug the size of my fingernail clinging to a piece of lettuce from the salad bar.  Makes me think that they don't wash the lettuce -- what else don't they wash before serving it?  GROSS - goodbye fountain cafe.  there are better places to go in the Crocker.

excerpts: Their salad bar is pretty extensive and I've liked the sandwiches I've gotten there for lunch.
salad bar.author: Kristina B.
salad bar.review: This place is great! I've gotten both breakfast and lunch here and had great food both times. Breakfast is really good, I've tried their bagel sandwiches and omelets and they were both great. Their salad bar is pretty extensive and I've liked the sandwiches I've gotten there for lunch.

excerpts: They also have a great salad bar.
One of the most reasonably priced places in the financial district.
I highly recommend it!
salad bar.author: Monica G.
salad bar.review: AWESOME breakfast sandwiches and BLTs! They also have a great salad bar. One of the most reasonably priced places in the financial district. I highly recommend it!

excerpts: The salad bar has a large selection of fresh fruits and veggies.
Items off the menu are standard diner fare.
salad bar.author: Lisa R.
salad bar.review:
Pros: The salad bar has a large selection of fresh fruits and veggies. Items off the menu are standard diner fare. They have a large chip and drink section too. 

Cons: Falafels are dry. The soups tend to be on the saltier side.

Also, their daily dish  is pretty tempting...just avoid the Caesar salad - it's soaked in the dressing.

excerpts: The prices are cheap and their salad bar is great for a light meal--I always end up getting the same two types of pasta salads and fix up a small salad for myself.
salad bar.author: Marsha Z.
salad bar.review:
I'm back working nearby, so I've had a chance to come back to Fountain Cafe numerous times in the past several months since 2006.  It's really the only restaurant in the Galleria that's satisfying enough to go back to on a regular basis.

The prices are cheap and their salad bar is great for a light meal--I always end up getting the same two types of pasta salads and fix up a small salad for myself.  And if I don't feel like splurging at Bistro Burger, their veggie burger and fries are a steal.  

Even with the stress of dealing with hoards of customers during the lunch rush, the cashiers always seem to put on a happy face.

excerpts: I like that they have a variety of choices for the salad bar, and the sandwiches we've had here have been tasty as well.
It's not the best food we've ever had, but it's pretty darn solid too.
I can't complain, and he enjoyed watching the baseball games during lunch on the tvs too, so that definitely helped!
salad bar.author: Quynh-An P.
salad bar.review: The boyfriend and I have come here a few time for our lunch dates (yay for working near each other!) and we've both enjoyed it.  I like that they have a variety of choices for the salad bar, and the sandwiches we've had here have been tasty as well.  It's not the best food we've ever had, but it's pretty darn solid too.  I can't complain, and he enjoyed watching the baseball games during lunch on the tvs too, so that definitely helped!

excerpts: Their salad bar is awesome!
salad bar.author: Aalok P.
salad bar.review:
Very affordable for the Financial District!  A wide variety of options for breakfast and lunch.  Their salad bar is awesome!

My breakfast favorite: Bagel w/ cream cheese and vegetables (brussel sprouts, cucumbers, and tomatoes) for just $2.75 (tax included).  Doesn't get much better than that....

They have online ordering and if you call by phone they're nice w/ accommodating specific requests (well toasted bun, add jalapenos/pickles, etc.).  The staff is very friendly as well.

excerpts: Their salad bar is pretty sizable if you're into that kind of thing
(I'm a sandwich guy).
Overall, I am a big fan of Fountain and will continue to drop by when I'm in the neighborhood.
salad bar.author: Peter C.
salad bar.review: Mmmm, Fountain... Like everyone's favorite geyser, this deli/cafe in the Galleria is as dependable as they get. The food is good and the staff is very friendly. I recommend the french toast for breakfast or the turkey-cran sandwich for lunch. Their salad bar is pretty sizable if you're into that kind of thing (I'm a sandwich guy). Overall, I am a big fan of Fountain and will continue to drop by when I'm in the neighborhood.

excerpts: I'm a regular at Fountain Cafe, I usually get either a make your own sandwich or do the salad bar.
I like this place because everything is really fresh and there is a lot to choose from in the salad bar.
You just load up whatever you want, salad, fruit or one or more of the assortment of pasta salads and they weigh it
and that's how the price is determined.
I love this because I usually can't eat a whole portion of our meal sizes these days
salad bar.author: Danielle G.
salad bar.review:
I work across the street from the Galleria so this is so convenient! I'm a regular at Fountain Cafe, I usually get either a make your own sandwich or do the salad bar. I like this place because everything is really fresh and there is a lot to choose from in the salad bar. You just load up whatever you want, salad, fruit or one or more of the assortment of pasta salads and they weigh it and that's how the price is determined. I love this because I usually can't eat a whole portion of our meal sizes these days so I only take what I can eat. 

Overall I would say their prices are the lowest i've found for good quality in the financial district so that is a huge plus! Service is pretty consistent and fast and you can usually find a table if you want to eat there

excerpts: Quite a salad bar they have.
Open kitchen for cooking fresh burgers.
It smelled really good
and I found the salad bar impressive (they had pasta salad in addition to the greens), but the hot dishes looked so good.
I didn't know how the place worked so got the tortellini and a side of veggies.
They gave me half a box of each and a flat fee of around 8 bucks, no weighing.
salad bar.author: Amy N.
salad bar.review:
Quite a salad bar they have.
Open kitchen for cooking fresh burgers. It smelled really good and I was hungry.

Hot dishes that need to be microwaved (which I don't really get, but at least food isn't actively overcooking), but it's a large selection with specials everyday. I saw meatloaf, fish (they can run out), white rice, brown rice, pasta, chicken, veggies, mashed potatoes, gravy (YAY!) and more. 

This was my first visit and I found the salad bar impressive (they had pasta salad in addition to the greens), but the hot dishes looked so good. I didn't know how the place worked so got the tortellini and a side of veggies. They gave me half a box of each and a flat fee of around 8 bucks, no weighing. Not what I was expecting and a LOT of food! 

The tortellini in tomato cream sauce with chicken was tasty and filling, as were the veggies. If you're getting takeout, I recommend sharing or planning on the same meal for two lunches. I'll definitely come back to try other dishes there.

excerpts:
but I get one thing only:

SALAD BAR
salad bar.author: Scott P.
salad bar.review:
Everything looks like it would be tasty but I get one thing only:

SALAD BAR

At a price of $6.39/lb it really is a great deal. It surprasses the one at Whole Foods.  And certainly Mixt Greens.

You will be very happy you went for lunch.  Check it out.

excerpts: Fabulous salad bar, and the best croutons ever!
My son enjoyed the French Toast for lunch, and said it was excellent as well.
salad bar.author: Nancy C.
salad bar.review: Fabulous salad bar, and the best croutons ever!  My son enjoyed the French Toast for lunch, and said it was excellent as well.

excerpts: like Lee's or Julies Kitchen, I never know where to stand....or what to do, or who to order from, and if i choose to get anything from the salad bar, i always end up with a container that weighs 10 lbs, and costs me $20.45.
So today I opted for a sandwich, so as to know what i would be paying when i got to the cashier.
No surprises.
salad bar.author: Lauren F.
salad bar.review:
Places like this scare me....like Lee's or Julies Kitchen, I never know where to stand....or what to do, or who to order from, and if i choose to get anything from the salad bar, i always end up with a container that weighs 10 lbs, and costs me $20.45.  So today I opted for a sandwich, so as to know what i would be paying when i got to the cashier.  No surprises.  The chicken salad sandwich was great, and i would probably come back here to try another cold sandwich, or something from their hot menu that looked pretty great as well.  

Get it to go and dine on the rooftop.

excerpts: Fountain Cafe has a nice salad bar and a good selection of sandwiches.
Today I enjoyed a trip to the salad bar and a BLT w/ avocado.
I left the place for under $10.
Put it in the lunch rotation.
salad bar.author: Corey V.
salad bar.review: Kia B. treated me to a free lunch! I know there's no such thing, but I'm basking in the glory for now. Fountain Cafe has a nice salad bar and a good selection of sandwiches. Today I enjoyed a trip to the salad bar and a BLT w/ avocado. I left the place for under $10. Put it in the lunch rotation.

excerpts: The salad bar is pretty good in terms of the selection and refill rate.
The sneeze guard configuration is kind of awkward.
I can't reach far enough in to retrieve my salad item without coming too close to the plexi.
Not so close that I have to kiss it, but still too close for comfort.
There are a usually a few facial grease imprints from those who couldn't reach yet insisted on doing so.
salad bar.author: Trixie J.
salad bar.review:
The salad bar is pretty good in terms of the selection and refill rate. The sneeze guard configuration is kind of awkward. I can't reach far enough in to retrieve my salad item without coming too close to the plexi. Not so close that I have to kiss it, but still too close for comfort. There are a usually a few facial grease imprints from those who couldn't reach yet insisted on doing so. Disturbing.

I tried their tuna casserole today. Tasted like Betty Crocker's Tuna Helper. Gave me gas all afternoon. I am usually not a gassy person; it took a great deal of control to slowly release these farts so that they're not audible. Double disturbing. :P

Avoid the tuna casserole unless you're planning on some smelly evil-doing at the office. Allow 2 hours for results.

excerpts: BIG food, REALLY good Salad bar, great sandwiches - paninis, crepes, hot food, pancakes!
GREAT choices.
salad bar.author: dawn g.
salad bar.review:
We (me & my office mates) eat here ALL the time. There are so many choices and it's always good. Maybe in the course of 5yrs going here there has been 3 bad experiences. Breakfasts are great, lunches are excellent-the food you get for the price you pay is WELL worth it in comparison to some of the rip-off places in this area. 
BIG food, REALLY good Salad bar, great sandwiches - paninis, crepes, hot food, pancakes!  GREAT choices.

excerpts: When I need a quick and heathy lunch, I come here for the salad bar.
There are a ton of different options, and everything is always fresh.
The place is usually busy, but never so crowded that I feel rushed to select my lunch
and I think I've only stood in line to pay maybe twice of the dozen times I've been here, and the line was never more that a three minute wait.
salad bar.author: Emily V.
salad bar.review: When I need a quick and heathy lunch, I come here for the salad bar.  There are a ton of different options, and everything is always fresh.  The place is usually busy, but never so crowded that I feel rushed to select my lunch and I think I've only stood in line to pay maybe twice of the dozen times I've been here, and the line was never more that a three minute wait.

excerpts: (I'm not a salad bar kind of guy...especially when I run the risk of ending up with a $10+ box of lettuce and tomatoes.)
salad bar.author: Chanson H.
salad bar.review: Good ole dependable cafeteria type place.  I used to make lunch plans around lasagna Thursdays.  It hits the spot just right for me.  Not an overly fancy Italian iteration of this pasta, but a very businesslike cheesy casserole.  Their turkey sandwich on sourdough roll is also just right with fresh quality fixins to satisfy you on those days when you want something a little lighter for lunch.  (I'm not a salad bar kind of guy...especially when I run the risk of ending up with a $10+ box of lettuce and tomatoes.)

excerpts: I mean GREAT salad bar that isn't super expensive.
Of course, I'm talking about the whole sans
carbs deal.
They often have some good hot food too at the salad bar, but mostly cold.
The heart of palm is really good and they have cubed ham and cheese as well.
I just love this place because I can get small portions of healthy food and not have to spend a sweater's worth of money.
salad bar.author: Ronjini M.
salad bar.review: I absolutely adore the Fountain Cafe, it saves me during diet time and its super close to work.  Although they have a mexican food stand within the cafe, they have a GREAT, I mean GREAT salad bar that isn't super expensive.  Of course, I'm talking about the whole sans carbs deal.  They often have some good hot food too at the salad bar, but mostly cold.  The heart of palm is really good and they have cubed ham and cheese as well.  I just love this place because I can get small portions of healthy food and not have to spend a sweater's worth of money.

excerpts: They also have a salad bar and other hot food.
Oh, and a tasty breakfast burrito.
It's cheap, fast, good and the employees are all really nice.
Exactly what I need when I'm on my lunch break!
salad bar.author: Dana G.
salad bar.review: This is one of my go-to lunch places.  They have an awesome variety of sandwiches and the burgers are delicious.  They also have a salad bar and other hot food.  Oh, and a tasty breakfast burrito.  It's cheap, fast, good and the employees are all really nice.  Exactly what I need when I'm on my lunch break!

excerpts: They also have a big salad bar which I've been told is good, but haven't tried it yet.
People that work there are friendly too.
salad bar.author: Christine K.
salad bar.review: Been working in fidi for 2 months and this is the best lunch place I've found so far.  The chicken panini rocks - the balsamic vinegar is a nice touch and it makes the sandwich. They also have a big salad bar which I've been told is good, but haven't tried it yet.  People that work there are friendly too.

excerpts: I'd try the salad bar next time but for some reason I think it'll be hard for me to be impressed
cuz Ive
had Draeger's salad bar.
salad bar.author: Peggy W.
salad bar.review:
sandwiches were sub-par.  used pretty low quality meats and the bread wasnt that great either.  And it took literally forever for my sandwich to come out.  

I'd try the salad bar next time but for some reason I think it'll be hard for me to be impressed cuz Ive had Draeger's salad bar.

excerpts: Their salad bar is delicious as well, but it's easy to go overboard and find yourself with a 50# salad.
Yikes.
Their other entrees are hit or miss, sometimes it's a delicious meal, sometimes it's only ok.
salad bar.author: Gusty S.
salad bar.review:
The BEST turkey burger in the city, bar none.  Unfortunately, I don't work downtown anymore, and every time I've been by during my shopping hours they are closed.  Their salad bar is delicious as well, but it's easy to go overboard and find yourself with a 50# salad.  Yikes.  Their other entrees are hit or miss, sometimes it's a delicious meal, sometimes it's only ok.  I've never had any terrible meals here though.

However, there are some problems.  First off, I've obliquely mentioned their hours, which I've never bothered to actually figure out, but I assume they are only open for business day lunchtime.  Then there is their ordering system, which is complete chaos.  I have no idea how they have never screwed up my order, but I have seen several people get theirs messed up.  It's also above average price wise, so it's no bargain lunch.

A side bonus to ordering here is being able to take your lunch up to the roof of the Crocker Galleria and eat in relative peace.  It's rarely crowded, and usually sunny up there, so it's a nice lunch break from a busy day.

excerpts: The other food and salad bar looked equally tempting
and I saw one of the hamburgers which was huge and looked really good.
I'll be back.
This is a find in the financial district if you want comfort food.
salad bar.author: Nicholette M.
salad bar.review: I was in the mood for a real grilled cheese sandwich and Fountain Cafe blew it away!  I ended up ordering a grilled ham and cheese with fries and it was really, really good and only $8.35 for a huge sandwich and pile of freshly made fries.  The other food and salad bar looked equally tempting and I saw one of the hamburgers which was huge and looked really good. I'll be back.  This is a find in the financial district if you want comfort food.

excerpts: Their salad bar seems pretty decent, though, although not spectacular.
salad bar.author: Yan G.
salad bar.review:
Fountain Cafe is good because it's inside Crocker Galleria and it's inexpensive.  These are the only two redeeming qualities of this establishment.

I got one of the 'the specials' today - poached salmon with mashed potatoes and salad.  It was a lot of food for $7.50, but none of it was any good.  The salmon was dry and cold, mashed potatoes were mealy and tasteless, and caesar salad was soggy and drenched in dressing.  

I was lucky enough to get some fruit salad which was also soggy and not particularly fresh.  Besides, the fruit salad and the caesar salad in my to-go box became more than friends very quickly.  Have you ever had a piece of honeydew covered in parmesan cheese and caesar dressing?  Yum!  Actually, it was pretty disgusting.

Their salad bar seems pretty decent, though, although not spectacular.

Go at your own risk!

excerpts: I've eaten several times, samping their salad bar (decent) to sandwiches (more miss than hit) - this is just average.
salad bar.author: Sean G.
salad bar.review:
Meh. 

I've eaten several times, samping their salad bar (decent) to sandwiches (more miss than hit) - this is just average. The are quite a few vegetarian options available (falafel, grilled cheese, veggie burger), but nothing to really write home about. 

The only thing that really spins my wheels here is the avocado sandwich on sourdough roll - the roll is just about chewy and the avocado is generous enough to make it enjoyable.

excerpts: The salad bar has fallen drastically on my rating chart.
Thier hot food is pretty decent except for the lasagna...not good.
They do have grilled chicken and steamed veggies w/ herbs.
They have hummus....
I love hummus.
They minus another star because the place is humid and smells like the grilled hamburgers they make.
salad bar.author: Jay H.
salad bar.review:
The only thing good here are the sandwiches.  The salad bar has fallen drastically on my rating chart.   Thier hot food is pretty decent except for the lasagna...not good.   They do have grilled chicken and steamed veggies w/ herbs. 

They have hummus....I love hummus. 

They minus another star because the place is humid and smells like the grilled hamburgers they make.

excerpts: Not obesity-generous but not the usual yuppie salad bar nouveau cuisine of "Good Omens"
salad bar.author: Christina C.
salad bar.review:
On a day when I needed comfort in its most pure, creamy, ideal state, this place served me a monster portion of mac and cheese in a friendly manner, provided hot crushed red pepper flakes (die, taste buds DIE!), and charged me less than $5 including tax.  Take that Assqew.

My classmates and I were waiting around the top of the escalators at the Crocker Galleria, being a general nuisance and fire hazard.  Unable to wait any longer (it wasn't getting any hotter after all), I dug in to the take-away container of gooey-ness.  At least 4 grown up people oogled my dish with pleasant surprise and asked me if that was mac and cheese in the tone usually reserved for, "Is that really a Prada bag on sale for 90% off?"  I felt quite smug and self satisfied with my choice of nourishment and the lunch world around this BART station opened up a little more.  

The other offerings on the menu were at very decent prices and I saw the portions they offered.  It was decent.  Very decent.  Not obesity-generous but not the usual yuppie salad bar nouveau cuisine of "Good Omens"  It was enough for grown men to have a satisfying meal without the burden of having leftovers to take home or the angst of throwing perfectly good food away.  

I'll be back to try their grilled sandwiches.  When the temperature takes a nose-dive and the weather is on the rag, nothing warms that void where my heart should be like a grilled sandwich with turkey and sprouts. 

Did I mention that half a roast chicken was only going to cost $4.50?  You could pay $4.50 for half a roast chicken, or for ONE grilled chicken breast.  Which would you chose?  Depends if you're on Atkins or not!

excerpts: The main reason I come here is for the salad bar...
but if it's a hot day out, get there early because most of the good salad toppers are gone.
salad bar.author: Jennifer S.
salad bar.review:
This is the best place to get a salad because you can put whatever the hell you want on it.  They charge by weight, so you don't feel bad if you just want a little bit.  

I wish I took my lunches earlier, because then I'd be able to try their daily specials.  I avoid the financial district lunch hour because it usually means that it takes longer to get my food than the time I have left to eat.  By 2:30 the specials are all gone!  But they have hearty sandwiches and their burgers aren't bad.  

The main reason I come here is for the salad bar...but if it's a hot day out, get there early because most of the good salad toppers are gone.

excerpts: Yes, the salad bar is fresh but I could get a large pre-made salad for a better price.
Aiya!!
salad bar.author: J B.
salad bar.review:
Yucky expensive grilled cheese sandwich!  I read one review that the grilled cheese was good and it's total crap.  For $5, it was a simple grilled cheese but the worst part was it was totally flattened and then they put a pickle on top and wrapped it w/ sandwich paper.  I open my sandwich and the bread was slightly soaked with pickle juice.

I also made a salad and didn't realise they charged $6.95/lb!  My small salad was another $4!!!  Outrageous!!  Yes, the salad bar is fresh but I could get a large pre-made salad for a better price.  Aiya!!

excerpts: I would say 2 stars but everything else in the Galleria food court is such a letdown that I'm giving this 3 stars because the salad bar is pretty good and the cooked food is okay.
I had a pretty tasty create-your-own salad (the dolmas were a great plus since a salad can be a weak lunch), and one time I tried the chicken enchiladas with Spanish rice.
It was so-so; the guy who served it was really nice.
salad bar.author: Molly P.
salad bar.review: I would say 2 stars but everything else in the Galleria food court is such a letdown that I'm giving this 3 stars because the salad bar is pretty good and the cooked food is okay.  I had a pretty tasty create-your-own salad (the dolmas were a great plus since a salad can be a weak lunch), and one time I tried the chicken enchiladas with Spanish rice.  It was so-so; the guy who served it was really nice.

excerpts: The positives here are several, #1 best salad bar in croker (by best i mean only), which is not saying much because even something like Julies kitchen, i think, offers better variety, #2 generally the place seems pretty efficient, and #3 looks like their employees care more about good customer service more than your average aloof chinese restaurant staff like lets say new ming's, 2 blocks away.
salad bar.author: Oleg H.
salad bar.review: yet another 3 star Crocker establishment (if i could though - id give them 3.5). The positives here are several, #1 best salad bar in croker (by best i mean only), which is not saying much because even something like Julies kitchen, i think, offers better variety, #2 generally the place seems pretty efficient, and #3 looks like their employees care more about good customer service more than your average aloof chinese restaurant staff like lets say new ming's, 2 blocks away.

excerpts: I checked out the menu and the price as well as their Grille and their well stocked salad bar.
If I was still in the work force, this place would be a "habit" for me.
The burgers looked delish, but I settled for their Fish n' Chip ($6.50).
I like my fish batter to be coated with flour, milk and eggs (like Picadilly Fish n' Chip).
The batter was a bread type
so it was tasty
but I like crispy to the max.
As one reviewer wrote the Fries was tops ($1.75 if you don't order an entree special with it).
An open call to Yelpers in the FiDi, I would love to meet up for lunch here if you want company.
salad bar.author: Marian G.
salad bar.review:
[review no. 50]

                                       WWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW

After being sent on my merry way from Nichols Research for a consumer panel discussion (which I was handsomely paid $125 for not participating)  on 44 Montgomery Street~~~I sauntered over to the Crocker Galleria to see the new Under One Roof Christmas Shoppe.  The aroma of the third floor had me floating on the escalator and into Fountain Cafe.   Reading the 49 reviews prior to my writing, I was glad I dropped in before the Noon crowd.  I checked out the menu and the price as well as their Grille and their well stocked salad bar.  If I was still in the work force, this place would be a "habit" for me.  The burgers looked delish, but I settled for their Fish n' Chip ($6.50).    I like my fish batter to be coated with flour, milk and eggs (like Picadilly Fish n' Chip).  The batter was a bread type so it was tasty but I like crispy to the max.  As one reviewer wrote the Fries was tops ($1.75 if you don't order an entree special with it).    An open call to Yelpers in the FiDi, I would love to meet up for lunch here if you want company.

excerpts: I maintain that the Fountain's salad bar is the best downtown - it's got everything, even hearts of palm, which I go crazy for.
Now if you're into lots of non-salad-ingredient-type-ingredients-like-lasagna-or-stir-fry-veggies, well go to Lightening Foods or something.
This place is for salad lovers only.
And it's a good place for lunch dates because there's a grill and tons of delish non-salad options.
Lot's of good indoor/outdoorish seating options, too.
The only drawback is that it seems like it's always about a million degrees in there.
5 years of coming here and still can't figure that out.

excerpts: The salad bar is pretty good.
Haven't tried the pastas and dishes during lunch, but they look good.
The fresh squeezed OJ is good.
I would give the quality of the food here 3.5 stars out of 5, but the variety makes it a 4.
Prices are also decent.
Not super cheap, but not super pricey either.
Pretty much what you would expect in the financial district.
salad bar.author: Ada K.
salad bar.review: The food can be good or bad depending what you get.  For the most part, it's decent.  Just don't get the crepes.  They're not good at all.  Our office frequently goes here to get breakfast take out.  The eggs are pretty standard.  Pancakes and french toast are standard.  Potatoes and hashbrowns aren't the best.  My coworkers really like the breakfast burritos.  I had a cheeseburger with avocado here before and it was pretty good.  The salad bar is pretty good.  Haven't tried the pastas and dishes during lunch, but they look good.  The fresh squeezed OJ is good.  I would give the quality of the food here 3.5 stars out of 5, but the variety makes it a 4.  Prices are also decent.  Not super cheap, but not super pricey either.  Pretty much what you would expect in the financial district.

the bads:

excerpts: This review is for the salad bar only!
The salad bar is awesome!!
they have a couple prepared salads such as pesto pasta salad, curry pasta chicken salad, couscous, potatoes..etc.
But the selection of salad choices is the best I've seen.
They offer 3 types of lettuce, green/red peppers, cheeses, pumpkin seeds/almonds, chicken, tuna, onions, chickpeas/kidneybeans, corn, peas, and the list goes on.
In addition, they have an extension to their salad bar that has at least 15+ dressings in all different flavours and offered in low fat/full fat forms.

This review is for the salad bar only!

The salad bar is awesome!! they have a couple prepared salads such as pesto pasta salad, curry pasta chicken salad, couscous, potatoes..etc. But the selection of salad choices is the best I've seen. They offer 3 types of lettuce, green/red peppers, cheeses, pumpkin seeds/almonds, chicken, tuna, onions, chickpeas/kidneybeans, corn, peas, and the list goes on. In addition, they have an extension to their salad bar that has at least 15+ dressings in all different flavours and offered in low fat/full fat forms.

The lady next to me last time that I went had the french toast and it smelled really good!
Maybe I'll try it next time...

salad bar.review: I really like the Fountain cafe for a tasty lunch. I have tried two different sandwiches now and they were both good. They have a wide variety of lunch items such as: cold sandwiches, hot sandwiches, salad bar, breakfast items, and hot lunch. excerpts: Great lunch spot, fabulous salad bar (they ran out of croutons once, that makes me sad but it hasn't happened since--and they have a really good creamy caeser dressing)
they have cool daily specials that are adequate comfort food fare: ribs, macaroni & cheese, mashed potatoes, roasted chicken, lasagna.
They have a decent chili (even better if you stock up on the free crackers at the condiment bar--and don't forget to pile on the cheese!).
They have yummy grilled cheese sandwiches (served with a pickle slice--bonus!)
and they do breakfast too!
They have okay burgers and fish & chips.
Not the best
but they won't make you sick or anything.
For a burger I prefer to spend a bit more and walk the extra 2 blocks to Bistro Burger.
I have to thank Fountain Cafe, though, for being my go-to spot for lunch when I can't make up my mind and don't want to be let down.
If you're one of those people who HAS to take their lunch right at 12:00 PM on the dot, then call in your order.
This place is an absolute zoo during the weekday lunch rush.
The employees handle it well, though, or else I would never have the patience.
Thanks for being competent, people.
So appreciated.

salad bar.review: I love Fountain Cafe's proximity to my place of employment. Great lunch spot, fabulous salad bar (they ran out of croutons once, that makes me sad but it hasn't happened since--and they have a really good creamy caeser dressing) they have cool daily specials that are adequate comfort food fare: ribs, macaroni & cheese, mashed potatoes, roasted chicken, lasagna. They have a decent chili (even better if you stock up on the free crackers at the condiment bar--and don't forget to pile on the cheese!). They have yummy grilled cheese sandwiches (served with a pickle slice--bonus!) and they do breakfast too! They have okay burgers and fish & chips. Not the best but they won't make you sick or anything. For a burger I prefer to spend a bit more and walk the extra 2 blocks to Bistro Burger. I have to thank Fountain Cafe, though, for being my go-to spot for lunch when I can't make up my mind and don't want to be let down. If you're one of those people who HAS to take their lunch right at 12:00 PM on the dot, then call in your order. This place is an absolute zoo during the weekday lunch rush. The employees handle it well, though, or else I would never have the patience. Thanks for being competent, people. So appreciated.

excerpts: I love the salad bar here.
It is one of the best in the financial in my opinion.
Really other good hot food too.
Only problem has been a couple times they have accidently overcharged me and it was an absolute pain trying to get reimbursed.
Love the food, just always check your bill!
salad bar.author: A D.
salad bar.review: I love the salad bar here. It is one of the best in the financial in my opinion. Really other good hot food too. Only problem has been a couple times they have accidently overcharged me and it was an absolute pain trying to get reimbursed. Love the food, just always check your bill!

excerpts: However, I was in the mood for a hot lunch and threw my dice on the table to order their $8.19 Hot Entree with Salad, Veggie and Bread.
That day, it was a Grilled Pork Chop, but the grill was already shut off for cleaning.
hot entree.author: Ed U.
hot entree.review:
Oh wait, this isn't Foundation Cafe? What was I thinking? I was sauntering over to the Galleria looking for a late lunch when I noticed this place on the third floor with all the other fair-to-middling eateries. All of them appeared to be closing up shop at a bit past 2PM. I give the staff here credit for not shooing me away hungry, disgruntled and actually getting a sandwich at Jimmy John's, owned by a right-wing conservative who enjoys killing animals on safari like a certain dentist we all revile.

Thankfully I did not have to compromise myself politically and was able to order here or so I thought. Perhaps I should have played it safe and got a $4.99 BLT or even a $5.99 Reuben off the grill. However, I was in the mood for a hot lunch and threw my dice on the table to order their $8.19 Hot Entree with Salad, Veggie and Bread. That day, it was a Grilled Pork Chop, but the grill was already shut off for cleaning. So they took a cooked Pork Chop out of the fridge and nuked it along with a serving of mixed zucchini, yellow squash and carrots.

The vegetables weren't terrible, but that pork chop was dry to the bone with a slathering of sauteed mushrooms and onions making no-never-mind of the plate. No bread or salad either, just some congealed brown rice they forgot to nuke with the chop (photo: http://bit.ly/1Iq8c2p). Does this look good to you? Then you would have enjoyed the commissary at San Quentin. At least you get Jell-o there unless I'm remembering the wrong Jimmy Cagney movie. They didn't have microwave ovens back then.

FOOD - 2 stars...I wish they would have just said they had no hot food instead of serving something my mom would have made on one of her off days
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...diner set-up in the Galleria, no big whoop
SERVICE - 2 stars...ditto my comment about the food
TOTAL - 2 stars...stick with the sammies, less risk there

excerpts: Fountain Cafe has four hot entree specials each day in addition to a large menu featuring lots of regular breakfast and lunch selections.
hot entree.author: Wilhelm Y.
hot entree.review:
An excellent salad bar and terrific daily specials make the Fountain Cafe located on the top level of the Crocker Galleria a very good place for lunch.

Coincidentally I had the Pollo Cacciatori just like David D. on Tuesday afternoon.  A tender extended chicken leg piece with soft green and yellow bell peppers, slivered onions and meaty tomatoes served over a bed of rice with a creamy, crunchy, cheesy Caesar Salad and a soft torpedo roll on the side.

Fountain Cafe has four hot entree specials each day in addition to a large menu featuring lots of regular breakfast and lunch selections.  There is plenty of seating inside of the restaurant in addition to the vast number of tables and chairs along the outer railings of the center and in the Roof Garden.

The service is fast and friendly and the food is inexpensive and filling.

excerpts: - Turkey Cranberry Sandwich: ($6 ish)
turkey cranberry.author: Jerianne G.
turkey cranberry.review:
If i could give half stars, this place would be 3.5 at the most.

Located on the third floor of Crocker Galleria, the hubs & I stumbled upon this place because of the fancy sign to be honest. But when we approached the place, we saw that they sold breakfast platters, as well as sandwiches, crepes, and salads.

It's pretty spacious with several tables inside and outside. There is a self-serve salad bar in the back that you pay up at front. 

A lot of their foods are sort've pricey. They range from $2- $7 usually. We stuck with a sandwich and a wrap.
- Chicken Apple Salad Wrap: ($5 ish) This was a fairly decent wrap. Has a good amount of chicken and green apple slices along with red onions, lettuce, and a creamy vinagrette type of sauce.
- Turkey Cranberry Sandwich: ($6 ish) you can customize this sandwich by choosing your bread, cheese, and whether you want to remove condiments or add some. We had it with wheat roll and American cheese. This was also a fairly good sandwich. Has a nice amount of cranberry sauce and turkey, and the bread wasnt too hard to bite into. 

While the food was good, the workers were kinda snooty. The woman behind the register was sneering a lot at the other customers. Not sure if she was having an off day, but yeah, not the greatest customer service. Wifi is available but slow.

excerpts: You can get a dessert crepe or baked salmon with brown rice or a BLT or enchiladas here.
blt.author: Sunny S.
blt.review:
Let's count this down--makes it easier on both of us: 

10. Best breakfast burrito--you will instantly gain five pounds and you won't be able to eat for the rest of the day, but this hangover helper does the job. 

9. Fountain's salad bar is the chronic of all salad bars in the FiDi. They even have falafel! 

8. Clam chowder. It's not loaded with potatoes (i.e., filler). It's creamy. It's delicious. It's served on Fridays. It's $2.50. 

7. Bagels! There are all kinds of flavors. I recommend the jalapeño cheddar. Get it toasted. Get cream cheese on the side. Get $2.50 out of the bottom of your purse. Then get going. 

6. What in the hell is chicken coteletti? I don't know either, but one of these days I'm going to order it just for S&G. Fountain has it every day! 

5. All of their soups are yummy! Cream of asparagus, cream of cauliflower, cream of broccoli - oh yes, they are all yummy. 

4. They do serve beer, but why are you going to the Crocker Galleria to drink beer? 

3. Quick service--cause we're in a big hurry! Fountain has more than one person working the registers, and their menu is designed to move food out quickly. 

2. You can get a dessert crepe or baked salmon with brown rice or a BLT or enchiladas here. Now that's a diverse menu. 

~AND~ 

1. Yet another lunch spot under $10 in the FiDi. Hurrah!

excerpts: Today I enjoyed a trip to the salad bar and a BLT w/ avocado.
I left the place for under $10.
Put it in the lunch rotation.
blt.author: Corey V.
blt.review: Kia B. treated me to a free lunch! I know there's no such thing, but I'm basking in the glory for now. Fountain Cafe has a nice salad bar and a good selection of sandwiches. Today I enjoyed a trip to the salad bar and a BLT w/ avocado. I left the place for under $10. Put it in the lunch rotation.

excerpts: They have great BLT's, Chicken Salad Sandwiches, Breakfast, etc.

blt.review:
I love Fountain Cafe. The staff is really helpful and nice. 

I order food from Fountain all the time. They have great BLT's, Chicken Salad Sandwiches, Breakfast, etc.

They participate in the Galleria Frequent buyer stamp program. Problem is prices are very cheap that i'm always below $6.00 to even get a stamp.

LOVE IT.

excerpts: and I'm kind of picky about how I like tuna salad.
The Fountain's tuna is not trying too hard to be fancy, like the tuna at Boudin's... no celery or diced onion and its a pretty good portion too!
The fries are good and seemingly fresh but sometimes when I order too late in the day, not so much.
tuna salad.author: Shannon A.
tuna salad.review: I've only ever gotten sandwiches and fries here but they are decent for the price! I get the tuna sandwich every couple of weeks and I'm kind of picky about how I like tuna salad.  The Fountain's tuna is not trying too hard to be fancy, like the tuna at Boudin's... no celery or diced onion and its a pretty good portion too! The fries are good and seemingly fresh but sometimes when I order too late in the day, not so much.

excerpts: menu above the wall and some specials for the day...breakfast, salad, sandwiches or full entrees...weekday lunch and taking a sandwich...bacon, avocado and cream cheese sandwich $5.75...a small soda $1.75...
$7.65 total for a meal...fairly low pricing for a fidi lunch...tables plenty inside and more outside...hearty trays of pre-cooked meats and dishes for bigger meals available...
decent meal, large portions and cheap prices...
cheese sandwich.author: Hen A.
cheese sandwich.review: years of living in san francisco...having lived just up the street...first time visiting crocker galleria...never knew this existed...small and narrow shopping mall structure wedged between buildings...plenty of lunch options...fountain cafe upstairs...cafeteria style restaurant...menu above the wall and some specials for the day...breakfast, salad, sandwiches or full entrees...weekday lunch and taking a sandwich...bacon, avocado and cream cheese sandwich $5.75...a small soda $1.75...$7.65 total for a meal...fairly low pricing for a fidi lunch...tables plenty inside and more outside...hearty trays of pre-cooked meats and dishes for bigger meals available...decent meal, large portions and cheap prices...

excerpts: A hankering for a good old-fashioned grilled cheese sandwich led me here for lunch.
They had a pretty large menu, but for this kind of place, don't reach too far.
I really don't get why people order healthy food, fancy food or seafood at psuedo-greasy spoons.
cheese sandwich.author: jessica s.
cheese sandwich.review:
A good place to remember what the rest of the country eats for lunch, as opposed to $10 organic sustainable salads w/tofu.

A hankering for a good old-fashioned grilled cheese sandwich led me here for lunch. They had a pretty large menu, but for this kind of place, don't reach too far.  I really don't get why people order healthy food, fancy food or seafood at psuedo-greasy spoons. Really.

My larger than average sandwich, fries and fountain Diet coke set me back about 7 dollars, which is a touch too much for this kind of fare but it totally hit the spot. Too bad it's in a mall.

excerpts: I was in the mood for a real grilled cheese sandwich and Fountain Cafe blew it away!
I ended up ordering a grilled ham and cheese with fries and it was really, really good and only $8.35 for a huge sandwich and pile of freshly made fries.
cheese sandwich.author: Nicholette M.
cheese sandwich.review: I was in the mood for a real grilled cheese sandwich and Fountain Cafe blew it away!  I ended up ordering a grilled ham and cheese with fries and it was really, really good and only $8.35 for a huge sandwich and pile of freshly made fries.  The other food and salad bar looked equally tempting and I saw one of the hamburgers which was huge and looked really good. I'll be back.  This is a find in the financial district if you want comfort food.

excerpts: I leave that place, I end up smelling like a grilled cheese sandwich - especially at the lunch rush.
However, after an eventful Thursday night out, a breakfast sandwich with egg, sausage, cheese and jam on wheat hits the spiggity spot at 9am on a Friday morning.
cheese sandwich.author: Leslie G.
cheese sandwich.review:
I didn't give Fountain 5 stars because whenver I leave that place, I end up smelling like a grilled cheese sandwich - especially at the lunch rush.
However, after an eventful Thursday night out, a breakfast sandwich with egg, sausage, cheese and jam on wheat hits the spiggity spot at 9am on a Friday morning.
