I read one review that the grilled cheese was good
and it's total crap.
For $5, it was a simple grilled cheese but the worst part was it was totally flattened
and then they put a pickle on top and wrapped it w/ sandwich paper.
cheese sandwich.author: J B.
cheese sandwich.review:
Yucky expensive grilled cheese sandwich!  I read one review that the grilled cheese was good and it's total crap.  For $5, it was a simple grilled cheese but the worst part was it was totally flattened and then they put a pickle on top and wrapped it w/ sandwich paper.  I open my sandwich and the bread was slightly soaked with pickle juice.

I also made a salad and didn't realise they charged $6.95/lb!  My small salad was another $4!!!  Outrageous!!  Yes, the salad bar is fresh but I could get a large pre-made salad for a better price.  Aiya!!

excerpts: My favorite of late has been the avocado sandwich on wheat bread with lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, sprouts, and mustard for $3.99.
In my book that is a great deal.
avocado sandwich.author: Christian B.
avocado sandwich.review:
Healthy-food eaters, frugalistas, and vegans, take note. There are some great options here.

My favorite of late has been the avocado sandwich on wheat bread with lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, sprouts, and mustard for $3.99. In my book that is a great deal. I've added the vegetable soup of the day, which is vegan, for $3.00. 

As others have said, there are many options here. I'm thrilled to see a sandwich place that has reasonable prices, very fresh ingredients, and multiple vegetarian options.

excerpts: The only thing that really spins my wheels here is the avocado sandwich on sourdough roll - the roll is just about chewy and the avocado is generous enough to make it enjoyable.
avocado sandwich.author: Sean G.
avocado sandwich.review:
Meh. 

I've eaten several times, samping their salad bar (decent) to sandwiches (more miss than hit) - this is just average. The are quite a few vegetarian options available (falafel, grilled cheese, veggie burger), but nothing to really write home about. 

The only thing that really spins my wheels here is the avocado sandwich on sourdough roll - the roll is just about chewy and the avocado is generous enough to make it enjoyable.

excerpts: This is solely based on their Italian chicken panini
I was a little confused by the Italian chicken panini because it had a sweet apple smear on it with chicken.
italian chicken panini.author: Jonathan T.
italian chicken panini.review:
If you need that quick bite, this is your place to go.

This is solely based on their Italian chicken panini but I hope to amend my review soon based on their breakfast burritos. 

I was a little confused by the Italian chicken panini because it had a sweet apple smear on it with chicken. I don't think they confused my order because panini had chicken and is the only chicken panini on their menu.

The sweet Apple smear threw me off because that's not what I think of with "Italian".

I still hope to try their breakfast burrito because it's one of the only places I've found in FIDI that serves breakfast all day.

excerpts: I had an italian chicken panini here.
While chicken, bread, and cheese were good, balsamic vinegar ruined the sandwich.
It did not go well with the rest of the sandwich.
If it's gonna be "italian" they should put tomatoes instead of balsamic vinegar.
italian chicken panini.author: Jessica N.
italian chicken panini.review:
I had an italian chicken panini here.  While chicken, bread, and cheese were good, balsamic vinegar ruined the sandwich.  It did not go well with the rest of the sandwich.  If it's gonna be "italian" they should put tomatoes instead of balsamic vinegar.  Yuck.

Their ruben sandwich was fine though.   The cafe is too warm and stuffy inside, but the outside seating in the galleria was enjoyable.

excerpts: I liked the hamburger meat, buns and bacon.
The cheese *sucked*!
They use processed American cheese even though he said it was cheddar.
NOT!
If they used actual cheese that wasn't from a plastic wrapper
hamburger.author: Michael M.
hamburger.review:
This is a review on Fountain Cafe's burgers & fries. I ain't much of a salad man. =)

I've had their bacon cheese burger and regular burger with fries. I liked the hamburger meat, buns and bacon. The cheese *sucked*! They use processed American cheese even though he said it was cheddar. NOT! If they used actual cheese that wasn't from a plastic wrapper I betcha it would be way more tasty. 

The fries were good. Fresh, crispy and hot. Yummy! I also like their variety of drinks. I'm such a sucker for sparkling water and I like the 2 sizes of Pelegrino they offer. Mmm!

I also found the restaurant to be quite warm, enough to be somewhat uncomfortable. I actually started to sweat a bit. =(

excerpts: I'd love it if i could understand the man when he was telling me they were out of hamburger meat..
so anyway,
once i figured it out, I ordered a tuna sandwich instead, with fries and a diet coke.
The tuna was bland, could have used some salt, but there was a salt shaker there,
so i guess i was expected to fix that problem myself.
I later said "those fries weren't as good as mcdonalds"... which is sad.
I've heard this place has good pancakes...
but I don't like pancakes...
so... that's a pathetic 2 stars for Fountain Cafe.
hamburger.author: Caleb D.
hamburger.review: I'd love it if i could understand the man when he was telling me they were out of hamburger meat..  so anyway, once i figured it out, I ordered a tuna sandwich instead, with fries and a diet coke.  The tuna was bland, could have used some salt, but there was a salt shaker there, so i guess i was expected to fix that problem myself.  I later said "those fries weren't as good as mcdonalds"... which is sad.  I've heard this place has good pancakes... but I don't like pancakes... so... that's a pathetic 2 stars for Fountain Cafe.

excerpts: As a creature of habit, I always get the chicken sandwich (I think they call it chicken steak) and fries.
The seasoning is so good!
chicken steak.author: Mel C.
chicken steak.review:
I eat here about once a week. The quality of the food is good, as well as consistent. They have a large variety to choose from. As a creature of habit, I always get the chicken sandwich (I think they call it chicken steak) and fries. The seasoning is so good! The place is packed, but the service is fast.

They also have breakfast, which is nice if you have time to sit down.

excerpts: Very good cheese steak sandwiches, salad bar, soups, and the #8 sandwich is prettttty good as well.
There burgers are ok.. except for last time
I ordered one the bun got super soggy
and i pretty much ate a bunless burger.
cheese steak.author: Viv D.
cheese steak.review: this place is pretty good for going to grab some lunch during work. Very good cheese steak sandwiches, salad bar, soups, and the #8 sandwich is prettttty good as well. There burgers are ok.. except for last time I ordered one the bun got super soggy and i pretty much ate a bunless burger.

excerpts: I had a salad, my friend had a chicken cheese steak thing, and we shared a bottle of water.
Totally not worth it for the sub-par food.
cheese steak.author: Olivia T.
cheese steak.review: What a bust.  I had a Groupon-y thing worth $16 that I paid $8 for, but would definitely not return without a similar coupon.  Lunch for two was $19.  I had a salad, my friend had a chicken cheese steak thing, and we shared a bottle of water.  Totally not worth it for the sub-par food.

excerpts: Once to buy a Red Bull and now to satisfy the hot pastrami sandwich i've had for the past few weeks.
Both times the lady at the counter was stand off ish and annoying.
She also looks like she hates her life.
The place however, is nicely lit  with lots of seating.
hot pastrami.author: Kay M.
hot pastrami.review:
Meh.

Been working in the FiDi for almost three months now and I haven't had the time really to explore around. That, and I hate looking like an idiot tourist in my own hometown so I've been mainly sticking to the Crocker Galleria (awesome for its wifi and ample seating choices).

I've been to Fountain twice. Once to buy a Red Bull and now to satisfy the hot pastrami sandwich i've had for the past few weeks. Both times the lady at the counter was stand off ish and annoying. She also looks like she hates her life. The place however, is nicely lit  with lots of seating. I'll probably be back to try it again a few times before I really make up my mind about this place.

Brownie points for being one of the few places you can eat in the Financial District for less than 10 dollars (hate spending my money on food when it can go to more valuable use like the Michael Kors bag I've been eyeing!)

excerpts: Their ruben sandwich was fine though.
The cafe is too warm and stuffy inside, but the outside seating in the galleria was enjoyable.
ruben.author: Jessica N.
ruben.review:
I had an italian chicken panini here.  While chicken, bread, and cheese were good, balsamic vinegar ruined the sandwich.  It did not go well with the rest of the sandwich.  If it's gonna be "italian" they should put tomatoes instead of balsamic vinegar.  Yuck.

Their ruben sandwich was fine though.   The cafe is too warm and stuffy inside, but the outside seating in the galleria was enjoyable.

excerpts: I've only had the turkey burger here, but it's so good (and big!)
I keep going back for it.
Plus it's cheap - just $5!
turkey burger.author: Roger H.
turkey burger.review: I've only had the turkey burger here, but it's so good (and big!) I keep going back for it. Plus it's cheap - just $5!

excerpts: The only thing to NOT order - turkey burger.
BLEH
turkey burger.author: Farrell W.
turkey burger.review:
This place has a huuuge menu.  Fresh salad, above average sandwiches, and damn decent entree's all for affordable prices.  It's tough to break the $10 mark for lunch.  NO TIP NECESSARY!!  cha ching

Ask for a frequent customer card, I ate here for weeks before I realized they had one - sneaky bastards wont say a thing.

The only thing to NOT order - turkey burger.  BLEH

excerpts: Turkey burger for $4.79 sounds good.
Except you get billed $8.50-something for adding avocado, day-old bacon, and a slice of cheddar.
Ridiculous.
AND, assholes, one spoonful of weak-ass guacamole is not the same as putting some avocado on a sandwich.
And your brown-ass lettuce and white-ass tomato aren't helping either.
No fries included, no chips, just "here's your suckass $9 burger, make sure to eat a dick on your way out.
turkey burger.author: That Was A Good Drum Break ..
turkey burger.review:
This place sucks and it has no soul and I'm only giving it a 2nd star because even if it' shit, there are options here you aren't going to find if you're stuck working downtown like me. 

Turkey burger for $4.79 sounds good. Except you get billed $8.50-something for adding avocado, day-old bacon, and a slice of cheddar. Ridiculous. AND, assholes, one spoonful of weak-ass guacamole is not the same as putting some avocado on a sandwich. And your brown-ass lettuce and white-ass tomato aren't helping either. No fries included, no chips, just "here's your suckass $9 burger, make sure to eat a dick on your way out."

The service is slow even when it's not crowded, and they aren't in a particular hurry to give a damn about you. I get the feeling these people have no passion in their lives, no spark, just "well I woke up today and if I make a sandwich I can keep buying these mom jeans at Marshall's and paying rent and then I can die."

Except for the guy on the grill, he seemed to wipe it down between every order. I used to be a grill man. Respect.

Everything here feels like a hotel, or an amusement park restaurant. I bet these people shop at Costco and just schlep this shit around.

If you are a corny office drone you will go here, you will order food, you will get the food you order, you will eat it, you will not die, and you will repeat the process. You will wonder what i am complaining about. 

If you respect style, effort, honesty, and realize that in this city there are a million places to put plants and animals into your stomach, you will never enter.

And the fucking ketchup bottles (big upside-down squeeze kind, also certainly purchased in a two-pack at Costco) were clogged shut, crusty, and empty. Fucking inexcusable for a sandwich joint to have broken ketchup, Fuck.

excerpts: The BEST turkey burger in the city, bar none.
Unfortunately, I don't work downtown anymore, and every time I've been by during my shopping hours they are closed.
turkey burger.author: Gusty S.
turkey burger.review:
The BEST turkey burger in the city, bar none.  Unfortunately, I don't work downtown anymore, and every time I've been by during my shopping hours they are closed.  Their salad bar is delicious as well, but it's easy to go overboard and find yourself with a 50# salad.  Yikes.  Their other entrees are hit or miss, sometimes it's a delicious meal, sometimes it's only ok.  I've never had any terrible meals here though.

However, there are some problems.  First off, I've obliquely mentioned their hours, which I've never bothered to actually figure out, but I assume they are only open for business day lunchtime.  Then there is their ordering system, which is complete chaos.  I have no idea how they have never screwed up my order, but I have seen several people get theirs messed up.  It's also above average price wise, so it's no bargain lunch.

A side bonus to ordering here is being able to take your lunch up to the roof of the Crocker Galleria and eat in relative peace.  It's rarely crowded, and usually sunny up there, so it's a nice lunch break from a busy day.

excerpts: The turkey burger is also pretty good.
You can expect to pay $5-$8 for a lunch.
The crepes are average.
turkey burger.author: Tushar K.
turkey burger.review: Good food, good quality, fast service. I work nearby so it's nice to have a place that's very efficient and even let's you call in orders. Wide selection of food items. I recommend the mac n cheese if they have it. The turkey burger is also pretty good. You can expect to pay $5-$8 for a lunch. The crepes are average.

excerpts: I love the salmon sandwich, the omelets, or the half chicken dinner.
Cant go wrong eating here.
Friendly staff, great facilities, and you can watch a game late in the afternoon while sipping a beer.
salmon sandwich.author: Thomas B.
salmon sandwich.review: Great choices for lunch. I love the salmon sandwich, the omelets, or the half chicken dinner. Cant go wrong eating here. Friendly staff, great facilities, and you can watch a game late in the afternoon while sipping a beer.

excerpts: you can customize this sandwich by choosing your bread, cheese, and whether you want to remove condiments or add some.
We had it with wheat roll and American cheese.
This was also a fairly good sandwich.
condiments.author: Jerianne G.
condiments.review:
If i could give half stars, this place would be 3.5 at the most.

Located on the third floor of Crocker Galleria, the hubs & I stumbled upon this place because of the fancy sign to be honest. But when we approached the place, we saw that they sold breakfast platters, as well as sandwiches, crepes, and salads.

It's pretty spacious with several tables inside and outside. There is a self-serve salad bar in the back that you pay up at front. 

A lot of their foods are sort've pricey. They range from $2- $7 usually. We stuck with a sandwich and a wrap.
- Chicken Apple Salad Wrap: ($5 ish) This was a fairly decent wrap. Has a good amount of chicken and green apple slices along with red onions, lettuce, and a creamy vinagrette type of sauce.
- Turkey Cranberry Sandwich: ($6 ish) you can customize this sandwich by choosing your bread, cheese, and whether you want to remove condiments or add some. We had it with wheat roll and American cheese. This was also a fairly good sandwich. Has a nice amount of cranberry sauce and turkey, and the bread wasnt too hard to bite into. 

While the food was good, the workers were kinda snooty. The woman behind the register was sneering a lot at the other customers. Not sure if she was having an off day, but yeah, not the greatest customer service. Wifi is available but slow.

excerpts: Not only did they provide delicious, good-quality food, they set up chafing dishes, included condiments such as several hot sauces and catsup for the breakfast burritos.
The French toast, eggs and bacon were nicely presented.
Everyone raved about the food asking where I catered it from.
Even the picky "foody" exec commented favorably.
All this at a price that post mates or any other delivery service would charge and throw the food at you and run.
I appreciate the care and friendly service they provided.
If you want great catering service go with Fountain Cafe.
They put in the extra effort to make your event special.
I'll be ordering from them again.
condiments.author: Lynn L.
condiments.review: I called Fountain Cafe to cater breakfast. Not only did they provide delicious, good-quality food, they set up chafing dishes, included condiments such as several hot sauces and catsup for the breakfast burritos. The French toast, eggs and bacon were nicely presented.  Everyone raved about the food asking where I catered it from.  Even the picky "foody" exec commented favorably.  All this at a price that post mates or any other delivery service would charge and throw the food at you and run.  I appreciate the care and friendly service they provided.  If you want great catering service go with Fountain Cafe.  They put in the extra effort to make your event special. I'll be ordering from them again.

excerpts: The salad bar is always fresh, with a nice selection of meats, veggies, and condiments.
The grilled chicken is always tasty.
I also love their tabouli as well.
Friendly staff.
I've been going there for years.
condiments.author: Martin B.
condiments.review: The best lunch deal in Crocker Galleria.  I ear from their salad bar so I can't comment on the hot food.  The salad bar is always fresh, with a nice selection of meats, veggies, and condiments.  The grilled chicken is always tasty.  I also love their tabouli as well. Friendly staff.  I've been going there for years.  I would go more often if they restated the salad bar selection from time to time.

excerpts: There is oatmeal and bacon and eggs and great coffee too in a spacious, well lit clean location in Crocker Square mall 3rd floor Financial District.
oatmeal.author: D J.
oatmeal.review: Hot breakfast platter early M-F. Stack of pancakes is ginormous so you may want to order the short stack and sides instead. There is oatmeal and bacon and eggs and great coffee too in a spacious, well lit clean location in Crocker Square mall 3rd floor Financial District.
